title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 23 January 2017 - XWiki
content:
has quit 00:08  has joined #xwiki 03:59  has quit 04:00  has joined #xwiki 04:01  has quit 08:25  has joined #xwiki 08:37  has joined #xwiki 08:43  has joined #xwiki 09:12  has joined #xwiki 09:14  has joined #xwiki 09:18  has joined #xwiki 09:29  has joined #xwiki 09:40  has joined #xwiki 09:42  has left #xwiki 10:52  has joined #xwiki 11:09  has quit 11:13  has joined #xwiki 12:49  has quit 12:49  has joined #xwiki 12:49  has quit 12:59  has joined #xwiki 13:01  How can i write
in xwiki? 13:01  has joined #xwiki 14:23  Hi Murilo: u can write
with a simple end of line or \\ 15:28  has quit 16:06  has quit 16:19  Hi, there is a way to get from main xwiki (6.4), all LOCAL groups of childrens? tmortagne vmassol 16:23  you mean an API? not sure what you mean by local groups of children 16:23  (hi) 16:26  hmm 16:28  from the farm, i need to know how nany local groups are stored in a provided wiki 16:28  has quit 16:29  like xwiki.rightsmanager.getGroupsApi.getAllLocalGroups() but for a provided wiki (child) vmassol 16:31  this API give me  all local group, but only the main wiki, not a child 16:31  I guess you could set the current wiki before calling this api 16:31  and reset it after 16:32  (if there's no direct api) 16:32  (I don't know these apis well at all) 16:32  how set wiki ? 16:32  you're in java? 16:32  in groovy? 16:32  has joined #xwiki 16:32  groovy or velocity 16:32  in groovy: 16:33  xcontext.getContext().setWikiId(id) 16:33  you need PR 16:33  you need to do a try/finally 16:34  to make sure to save the current wiki and reset it afterwards 16:34  xcontext.getContext().getWikiId() to get the current wiki id 16:35  thanks a lot ! 16:53  let me know if it works :) 17:34  has quit 17:38  has joined #xwiki 18:15  has quit 18:20  has joined #xwiki 18:21  has quit 18:59  has quit 19:15  has quit 19:19  has joined #xwiki 19:22  has quit 21:04  has quit 21:43  has joined #xwiki 21:44  has quit 21:49  has quit
